document_title: Acne: Causes, symptoms and risks you need to know
subsection_content:
Acne is a form of sebaceous follicle disease, with skin lesions caused by increased sebum secretion, deposited in the pores, accompanied by inflammation in the sebaceous follicles. The disease occurs in all ages, especially acne during puberty, or people with oily skin. (first)
If not treated properly and do not comply with treatment, the disease becomes more severe, leaving sequelae that are difficult to treat, causing the patient to feel guilty, have low self-esteem in communication, and reduce work efficiency.
In all cases, acne needs to be treated early, properly and sufficiently at medical facilities to reduce its severity and completely suppress the disease. From there, prevent and reduce the loss of aesthetics caused by acne scars.
